challengeInfo.generalInformation:
A delicious and healthy treat!

This week’s recipes are light and refreshing, so you have a little something to keep you going between lunch and dinner – without spoiling your appetite. 
Smoothies and juices are an excellent choice when you want a quick, nutritious snack.
challengeInfo.bodyBenifit:
Your body will love it!

High in fiber, vitamins and minerals, vegetables and fruits are healthy, low calorie snack choices. By including them in your juices and smoothies, you can enjoy a greater variety of nutrients.

Packaged juice drinks often contain less real juice than you think – and lots of sugar. By making your own juices and smoothies, you know exactly what goes into each glass. Your body enjoys the benefits of fresh fruit and vegetables.
challengeInfo.suggestions:
Handy juicing tips!

Make your juice using fresh ingredients – and if possible, buy organic.

Purchase fruit and vegetables daily. Bought too much? Freeze them for later use. 

Using frozen fruit will make your juice thick and frosty. Delicious!

To save calories, use low fat or fat-free milk or yogurt in smoothies. Almond milk is a tasty non-dairy alternative.

Want a thinner smoothie? Just add coconut water or fresh juice. Avoid adding packaged juices, as they often contain extra sugar and preservatives.

Try replacing bananas with avocado. This helps cut down on sugars – and adds lots of potassium, B-complex vitamins, antioxidants and fibers. 

Sweeten with care. There’s no need to add sugar – just pop in some sweet fruit. Or use agave syrup as a sweet alternative.

challengeInfo.generalInformation:
Healthy, convenient and portable!
Start your day with fresh, homemade juices and smoothies. This week, we’re going to help you keep going all morning long – with five days of quick and easy recipes. Drink them at home, or take them with you for a healthy breakfast on-the-go.

Fruits and vegetables can be prepared before you go to bed, so you can quickly make your smoothies and juices in the morning. Drink them while they are fresh, so you maintain all the nutrients.
challengeInfo.bodyBenifit:
A boost for your body!

We created recipes especially for a morning boost, to give you the energy to kick-start your morning.

Coconut water for energizing electrolytes and potassium
Bananas to keep you from feeling hungry 
Dairy products for a boost of protein  
Berries for extra radiance, as they help minimize skin irritation and redness
challengeInfo.suggestions:
Handy smoothie tips!

Remember, there’s a juice or a smoothie for every occasion and diet. So feel free to browse our recipes to find the right one for you.

Make sure your juice is packed with flavor and nutrients. When you want a cool and thick smoothie, don’t use ice – just add frozen fruit. Keep portions of berries or bananas in your freezer for instant access. 

For an extra boost of protein, add a scoop of your favorite chocolate or vanilla protein powder.

challengeInfo.generalInformation:
Get a good night’s sleep!

Sometimes it’s a struggle to get enough quality sleep. Some juices may actually help you sleep better. So we put together a week’s worth of recipes for you to try before before going to bed.
challengeInfo.bodyBenifit:
How can juices and smoothies help?

When we sleep, our mind and body are preparing for tomorrow, so you can wake up refreshed and ready for a new day. It’s important to relax before bedtime, so you can doze off peacefully.

Some ingredients in your juices in this challenge are especially good for increasing your melatonin levels, which helps reduce of time your take to fall asleep. It’s as if melatonin is telling your body “Ok, it’s time to sleep now!” This may support the actual number of hours you sleep – which improves alertness during the day.
challengeInfo.suggestions:
Cut it out!

Avoid drinking caffeine-rich drinks before bed.
Alcohol is known to disrupt sleep patterns.

challengeInfo.generalInformation:
Keep your immune system strong!

Vitamins are essential to our diet – and vitamins A and C are especially important to our immune system. So you need to make sure you eat enough fruit and vegetables. That’s where juices and smoothies can help!
challengeInfo.bodyBenifit:
Let’s talk about prevention!

As they say, an ounce of prevention with a pound of cure. Fruit and vegetables rich in vitamin A, C and D help ensure to that your immune system functions well.

Vitamin A plays a role in preventing infection. 
Vitamin C works to protect cells.
Vitamin D is crucial to activating our immune defenses.
challengeInfo.suggestions:
Spice up your health!

For an extra shot of health, add one or two cloves of garlic to any juice. Garlic contains sulfur-based compounds that act as powerful antibiotic and anti-viral agents.

challengeInfo.generalInformation:
Power up for workouts!

Exercise is an essential to staying fit and healthy. By balancing the right ingredients, fresh juices may help to keep you going during workout or repair muscles afterwards.

Hot, sweaty and in need of electrolytes after a heavy workout? Fresh juice is full of essential nutrients, and an easy way to top up your body’s vitamins and minerals.
challengeInfo.bodyBenifit:
Don’t sweat it!

The juices and smoothies in this challenge are full of natural ingredients that can help reduce the muscle pain and joint stiffness people often experience after exercising. Especially vitamin C helps boost your metabolism. 

We’ve also added fruits and vegetables that help your body eliminate toxins. And to help your body bounce back from a good workout, we included ingredients with plenty of sodium and potassium – which is precisely what your body needs after sweating a lot!
challengeInfo.suggestions:
Keeping hydrated!

If you are using juice to rehydrate after exercising, add extra water to your mix. Juices are best consumed after sports for recovery.

challengeInfo.generalInformation:
Boost your energy before exercising!

It‘s time to energize your day with fresh, homemade juice! Juices can help boost your energy levels before exercise, so you can get the most our of anything from low-intensity to endurance sports.
challengeInfo.bodyBenifit:
Revitalize your body!

Juices aren’t just tasty – they offer you vitamins and minerals that can help revitalize your body.

Iron can boost your energy and help fight fatigue
Vitamin B is essential for energy and the reduction of tiredness and fatigue
Enhance endurance with vitamin C – which also improves the body‘s ability to absorb iron
challengeInfo.suggestions:
More ideas for more energy!

Low quality carbs (like refined sugar) may give you a quick boost of energy, but you’ll also “crash” sooner. It’s better to choose high quality nutrient-dense carbs, like fresh fruit juice. Adding healthy fats (like nuts) and lean protein can give you long-lasting energy.

Staying hydrated is very important to fighting fatigue, as the body seems to be less productive when it’s dehydrated.

Are you trapped in a vicious cycle of stress and fatigue? Brighten up your day with energizing juices, and cut back on caffeine.

challengeInfo.generalInformation:
Cleanse your body with juice!

A juice detox is a short-term liquid diet that helps cleanse your body – both mentally and physically. You start by replacing one or more meals per day with one of the juices in the challenge. Your juice detox experience is also a great way to begin new, healthy eating habits – as your body has a mini-vacation from caffeine, alcohol and fatty foods.
challengeInfo.bodyBenifit:
How does it work?

Freshly made juices contain elements that can cleanse your body’s cells, and help keep them younger and healthier. 

A juice cleanse gives your digestive system a break, and helps to rid your body of toxins. So you become energized, balanced and focused.

By flushing out toxins from your system, you’re giving your body a chance to unleash its natural healing powers.
challengeInfo.suggestions:
Prepare for your detox!

Eat light food for three days before starting your detox, and make sure you drink plenty of water. 

If you are undergoing emotional stress, we do not recommend this detox program. Give yourself time to rest up and recover first. 

You may eat lightly during the detox. Choose organic fruits and vegetables, or nuts and seeds that have been soaked for a while. 

During your cleansing detox, exercise lightly. Be kind to your body! 

After your detox, begin eating solid foods gradually. On the first day after your detox, eat organic fruits and green vegetables. On the second day, add brown rice, eggs and yogurt. Five or six days after your detox, start adding chicken, fish or meat to your diet.

challengeInfo.generalInformation:
Be nice to your tummy!

Perhaps you have been eating food that’s too spicy or fat – or you have been eating too quickly. These are a few of the reasons people have problems with their digestive system, including bloating, gas and acid reflux. It’s time to revive your digestive system and be kind to your tummy!
challengeInfo.bodyBenifit:
How does it help?

Dietary fiber helps your intestines maintain regular bowel movements. Insoluble fibers are not digested. As they move through your system, they help prevent constipation. Soluble fibers dissolve in your system, some of which are a prebiotic to boost your digestive system.

Pineapple contains bromelain, which encourages proper digestion and helps your body break down the proteins in the food.

Lemon juice also helps support normal digestion and your intestines. 

The cellulose content of beets can help promote better bowel movements.
challengeInfo.suggestions:
Get the most out of your juice!

By adding a fruit and vegetable that are rich in dietary fibers to your breakfast juice, you can easily increase your intake of nutrients.

challengeInfo.generalInformation:
Glowing from the inside out!

Beauty is more than skin deep – it starts inside you! Juicing is a great way to get the micronutrients that can boost your beauty. With regular use, freshly made juices can have a remarkable effect on skin, hair and nails. Once you’ve tried the five-day challenge, you may just want to keep up this beauty routine.
challengeInfo.bodyBenifit:
Cleanse and heal!

In general, it’s better to include a nice variety of vegetable and fruits in your juices and smoothies – so you get a wide range of antioxidants, minerals and vitamins.

Skin also helps your body detox. Phytonutrients beets, apples, broccoli, cabbages and other cruciferous vegetables and leafy greens have a rejuvenating effect on cells in your liver cells and help speed up detoxification – so your skin doesn’t have to work so hard.   

Juicing also delivers a variety of trace minerals including iron, selenium, manganese, copper and zinc, all of which are necessary in various ways for achieving skin that is smooth and blemish free.
challengeInfo.suggestions:
Did you know?

Vegetable juices are more powerful than fruit juices, and have a greater impact on both your liver and your skin.

challengeInfo.generalInformation:
Enhance your wellbeing!

Juicing is more than creating delicious drinks – it can enhance your sense of wellbeing, too. This challenge is about making small changes, everyday, that can add up to greater vitality and clarity. And the good news is... when you add something healthy to your diet, you will most likely leave out something that’s less healthy. Feeling proud of this healthy achievement is another step towards wellbeing!

Vitamins, minerals and phytonutrients are a natural part of the juice recipes in this challenge. And because these ingredients work to enhance each others powers, a tasty blend becomes your secret to wellbeing.
challengeInfo.bodyBenifit:
A few handy ideas!

Use 70 % greens and 30 % fruits to help keep your body alkalized.

Adding a green juice to your daily routine is one of the fastest ways feel the effect of juicing.
challengeInfo.suggestions:
Keep up the good work!

How will you feel in five days? Keep a diary and note your moods and energy levels. 

If you only notice a slight difference, why not try the wellbeing challenge for two weeks?
